statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ 0 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 5 \\ 1 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 8 \\ 2 \\ 10 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ 3 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 2 \\ 0 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 5 \\ 1 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 8 \\ 2 \\ 10 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ 3 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
